titleInfo.title: Letter No. 70 from Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident at Bushire to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter reporting on events at Bushire prior to his return there from his Arabian coast tour. The events included a revolution in the Government of Bushire, which resulted in Shaik Ahmed ben Khamis [Aḥmad bin Khamīs] taking power.The letter goes on to give background on the Shaikh who had for some years previously been expelled from Bushire by the former Governor, Shaik Abdool Russool [Abd al-Rasūl Khān] and had been residing with the Chaub [Banū Ka‘ab] Shaikh near Bussorah [Basra]; his return to Bushire under the acting Governor Shaikh Mohamed [Muhammad], and his having gained sufficient influence and power to seize authority.The letter goes on to discuss the opinions of the townspeople, merchants and Arab tribes in the surrounding villages to the new Governor; his visit to Colonel Stannus; and the Colonel's decision not to formally recognise him as the new Governor until the title is confirmed by government at Shiraz.
